definition: horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent

sentences.english: Part Two591. The packing must be able to withstand rough handling.
sentences.chinese: 包装必须经得伏蛮横搬运。

sentences.english: Big boys sometimes domineer over the younger pupils.
sentences.chinese: 大男孩有时会蛮横地对待较年幼的小学生。

sentences.english: Chinese mind since then are stuffed with barbarian spirit of vulgarity and shamelessness .
sentences.chinese: 中国人的样子从当时候起就充溢了蛮横，俗气和无耻。

sentences.english: It has continued to act unreasonably.
sentences.chinese: 它还在继续无理蛮横的行为。

sentences.english: I know I just wanna lean on your shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你，不介意我偶尔对你的蛮横无理。

sentences.english: How can you suffer his insolence?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么能容忍他蛮横无礼？

sentences.english: A spoiled lamb will become an overbearing sheep.
sentences.chinese: 被宠坏的小羊将会长成蛮横的大羊。

sentences.english: Security is often invoked as a justification for harsh crackdowns on freedom.
sentences.chinese: 安全经常被用来作为蛮横镇压自由的借口。

sentences.english: Thaw with his gentle persuasion is more powerful than Thor with his hammer.
sentences.chinese: 用他温柔的消融劝说，远胜过挥斧雷神的蛮横。

sentences.english: He is on the phone again, raging about the horrible way his boss treats him.
sentences.chinese: 他又在打电话了，愤愤地叙说着老板对他的蛮横态度。

definition: the Way of the Hegemon/abbr. for 霸王之道/despotic rule/rule by might/evil as opposed to the Way of the King 王道/overbearing/tyranny/(of liquor, medicine etc) strong/potent
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
